intro: Ruilopezia emmanuelis, commonly known as the Emmanuel's grass, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Ruilopezia emmanuelis is adapted to survive in harsh, drought-prone environments, showcasing features such as deep root systems and reduced leaf surface area. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
